author: {'@type': 'Person', 'url': 'https://www.moneycontrol.com/author/pti-6883/', 'name': 'PTI'}
headline: Orchid Pharma gets USFDA nod for schizophrenia drug
description: In a filing to BSE, the company said it &quot;has received ANDA (abbreviated new drug application) approval from USFDA (United States Food and Drug Administration) for Aripiprazole Orally-Disintegrating tablets USP, 10 mg and 15 mg.&quot;
articleBody: Orchid Pharma today said it has received approval from the US health regulator for Aripiprazole Orally-Disintegrating tablets, used in treatment of schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.  In a filing to BSE, the company said it &quot;has received ANDA (abbreviated new drug application) approval from USFDA (United States Food and Drug Administration) for Aripiprazole Orally-Disintegrating tablets USP, 10 mg and 15 mg.&quot;  The tablets are atypical antipsychotic, indicated in the treatment of symptoms related to psychotic conditions such as schizophrenia and bipolar disorder (manic depression), it added.  Shares of the company were trading 4.87 per cent up at Rs 18.30 on BSE.

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: Orchid Pharma gets EIR from USFDA for its Alathur facility
description: The company has received EIR from the United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) based on the successful inspection of the active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) manufacturing facility at Alathur, Orchid Pharma said in a filing to BSE.
articleBody: Orchid Pharma today said it has received establishment inspection report (EIR) from the US health regulator for its Alathur facility in Tamil Nadu.  The company has received EIR from the United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) based on the successful inspection of the active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) manufacturing facility at Alathur, Orchid Pharma said in a filing to BSE.  The facility was inspected by the USFDA on May 2017, it added. Orchid Pharma stock shot up nearly 20 per cent to Rs 21.45 per scrip in the afternoon trade on BSE.
tags: BSE, Business, Companies, Orchid Pharma, pharma, USFDA

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: Orchid Pharma settles case with Sebi, pays Rs 5.25 lakh
description: In an order dated July 24, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) settled the &quot;possible proceedings&quot; against Orchid Pharma related to alleged non-compliances by the firm of Sebi's ICDR (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations.
articleBody: Orchid Pharma has settled a case related to alleged violation of disclosure norms with markets regulator Sebi after payment of Rs 5.25 lakh as settlement charges.  In an order dated July 24, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) settled the &quot;possible proceedings&quot; against Orchid Pharma related to alleged non-compliances by the firm of Sebi's ICDR (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations.  Orchid Pharma had filed an application with the regulator under settlement mechanism, that provides for settlement of cases without admitting or denying the charges.  The settlement terms proposed by the firm were considered by Sebi's High Powered Advisory Committee (HPAC), which recommended the case for settlement on payment of Rs 5.25 lakh by the company. The recommendation of HPAC was also accepted by the panel of whole-time members of the regulator.  Last month, the company paid the settlement amount of Rs 5.25 lakh and accordingly Sebi disposed of the possible proceedings.  However, Sebi said if any representation made by the firm in the settlement proceedings is subsequently discovered to be untrue, enforcement actions including commencing of proceedings can be initiated against it.

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Rakesh Patil'}
headline: Sell Orchid Pharma on rally, says Vijay Chopra
description: Vijay Chopra of enochventures.com advises selling Orchid Pharma.
articleBody: Vijay Chopra of enochventures.com told CNBC-TV18, &quot;Fundamentally speaking I looked at the balance sheet of Orchid Pharma and it is stressed. I would say that there are better opportunities in the pharma space if somebody wants to buy into those stocks. Wockhardt looks much better structurally and according to the balance sheet also one can get into the stock at this point of time.&quot;  &quot;Even Sun Pharmaceutical looks good but stock like Orchid Pharma I would suggest that one should get out on rallies as soon as possible because its balance sheets are stressed and I would say that it is not a good idea to stay in that stock, so better get out and get into some better story,&quot; he added.
tags: Orchid Pharma, Stocks Views, Sun Pharmaceutical, Vijay Chopra, Wockhardt

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Rakesh Patil'}
headline: Exit Orchid Pharma, says Prakash Gaba
description: According to Prakash Gaba of prakashgaba.com, one may exit Orchid Pharma.
articleBody: Prakash Gaba of prakashgaba.com told CNBC-TV18, &quot;So far Orchid Pharma has formed a base here. The structure is weak, so it has just formed a base and has given a breakout at Rs 29. Even if it does go up it is likely to find resistances, stiff resistance closer to Rs 36, one should exit there.&quot;  The share touched its 52-week high Rs 45.90 and 52-week low Rs 23.70 on 22 April, 2016 and 22 November, 2016, respectively.
tags: Orchid Pharma, Prakash Gaba of prakashgaba.com, Stocks Views

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: Orchid Pharma Q3 net loss narrows to Rs 60.97 cr
description: The company had posted a net loss of Rs 94.02 crore in the year-ago period, Orchid Pharma said in a BSE filing.
articleBody: Drug firm Orchid Pharma's standalone net loss narrowed to Rs 60.97 crore during the quarter ended December 31, 2016. The company had posted a net loss of Rs 94.02 crore in the year-ago period, Orchid Pharma said in a BSE filing. Its standalone total income from operations also declined to Rs 179.98 crore during the quarter under review from Rs 205.87 crore a year ago. Shares of Orchid Pharma today closed 2.47 percent down at Rs 29.65 ascrip on BSE.
tags: BSE, Drug firm, Orchid Pharma, Results

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: Orchid Pharma gets EIR report from USFDA on inspection closure
description: &quot;Orchid received the Establishment inspection report (EIR) from USFDA based on the successful inspection closure for the API manufacturing facility located at Alathur, Kancheepuram district. The facility was inspected by USFDA in the month of August 2015,&quot; the company said in a BSE filing today.
articleBody: Orchid Pharma has received the Establishment inspection report (EIR) from the US health regulator based on the successful inspection closure for its API manufacturing facility in Tamil Nadu's Kancheepuram district. &quot;Orchid received the Establishment inspection report (EIR) from USFDA based on the successful inspection closure for the API manufacturing facility located at Alathur, Kancheepuram district. The facility was inspected by USFDA in the month of August 2015,&quot; the company said in a BSE filing today. USFDA releases a copy of the EIR to the establishment that was the subject of an FDA or FDA-contracted inspection when the agency determines the inspection to be closed. Shares of Orchid Pharma were trading 6.84 percent up at Rs 41.40 apiece on BSE.
tags: BSE, Business, Establishment Inspection Report, manufacturing facility, Orchid Pharma, Tamil Nadu, USFDA

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: Orchid gets final nod from USFDA for Parkinson's drug
description: The nod from the USFDA for the first-to-file abbreviated new drug application (ANDA) with shared 180-day marketing exclusivity is for the strengths of 0.5 mg and 1 mg, Orchid Pharma said in a BSE filing.
articleBody: Chennai-based Orchid Pharma has received final approval from the US health regulator for its generic version of rasagiline tablets used in the treatment of Parkinson's disease. The nod from the USFDA for the first-to-file abbreviated new drug application (ANDA) with shared 180-day marketing exclusivity is for the strengths of 0.5 mg and 1 mg, Orchid Pharma said in a BSE filing. &quot;Orchid expects to launch this products in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2016-17,&quot; it added. Rasagiline mesylate tablets are indicated for the treatment of signs and symptoms of idiopathic Parkinson's disease. &quot;With a market size of over USD 300 million and limited generic competition&quot;, Orchid said it &quot;hopes to garner a decent market share from this product launch&quot;. Rasagiline tablets are sold under the brand AZILECT by Teva Pharmaceutical Industries. Orchid Pharma stock was trading up 12.18 percent at Rs 41.90 during the afternoon trade on BSE.
tags: AZILECT, BSE, Business, Orchid Pharma, tablet, US health regulator

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'webtech_news18'}
headline: Orchid Pharma inks pact with UK entity for &amp;#36;800 mn loan
description: Orchid Europe Ltd, UK, a wholly-owned subsidiary of the company has entered into a long-term financial arrangement to avail up to USD 800 million as loan with Line Trust International, Guernsey, UK, Orchid Pharma said in a filing to BSE.
articleBody: Orchid Pharma today said its subsidiary has inked a pact with UK's Line Trust International to avail loan of up to USD 800 million (about Rs 5,300 crore) to explore new growth avenues. Orchid Europe Ltd, UK, a wholly-owned subsidiary of the company has entered into a long-term financial arrangement to avail up to USD 800 million as loan with Line Trust International, Guernsey, UK, Orchid Pharma said in a filing to BSE. &quot;This funding will help the company explore new growth opportunities while enabling the current business achieve incremental value,&quot; it added. Orchid Pharma, formerly known as Orchid Chemicals &amp;amp; Pharmaceuticals, has earlier announced that it is in talks with banks to convert its rupee debt into dollar-denominated one. The company has a total debt of around Rs 3,100 crore. Set up in 1992 as an export-oriented unit, Orchid Chemicals &amp;amp; Pharmaceuticals has presence across segments such as anti-infectives, anti-inflammatory, central nervous system (CNS), cardio vascular segment (CVS), nutraceuticals and other oral and sterile products. &amp;nbsp;
tags: Business, nutraceuticals, Orchid Europe Ltd, Orchid Pharma, Pharmaceuticals
